diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Perforated sigmoid colon secondary to diverticulitis complicated by persistent abscess; Acute kidney injury in the setting of chronic kidney disease
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with nausea, fatigue, and increased drainage from a pigtail catheter. Physical examination revealed diffuse abdominal tenderness and purulent drainage. Laboratory findings indicated abnormalities such as elevated creatinine and potassium levels. Imaging showed mural thickening of the sigmoid colon with an increased size of a collection near the bladder, supporting the diagnosis of perforated diverticulitis.
